alert.note: Alert for Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 04 at 3:23AM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds around 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust expected. * WHERE...Stonewall County. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and a few power outages may result. Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.
